TEXT: The applicant is an NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

The applicant was an employee of ORG whose duty was to supervise the validity of payments made to taxpayers . On DATE , the applicant authorised to pay a company its tax credit although it was not entitled to it .
On DATE , ORG at ORG summoned the applicant to appear before ORG with a view to ascertaining his liability jointly with other employees for the damages caused to the ORG .
By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , ORG ordered the seizure of the applicant ’s property .
By a judgment of DATE , ORG found the applicant liable and ordered him to pay compensation to the ORG . CARDINAL judges of that Court ( D.R. and PERSON ) had also decided in the seizure proceedings .
The applicant ’s appeal against this judgment was dismissed by ORG on DATE .

Pursuant to LAW No . CARDINAL of the code of civil procedure , on CARDINAL DATE the applicant lodged an application with ORG to recall the above - mentioned judgment of CARDINAL DATE by reasons of errors of facts ( revocazione ) . CARDINAL judges of that Court ( G. and A. ) had already participated in the appeal proceedings . The application was declared inadmissible by a decision of DATE .

Pursuant to LAW . CARDINAL , on DATE the applicant lodged a second application with ORG to recall the judgment of DATE in order to be excluded from his joint liability . By a judgment of DATE , ORG declared that application inadmissible .
Under LAW . CARDINAL of DATE and LAW the proceedings before ORG can challenge the judge where there are reasons to doubt his impartiality .
Under LAW seq . of the civil code , civil servants are responsible for damages caused to the ORG during the performance of their duties .
Under LAW No . CARDINAL of the code of civil procedure , final judgments can be recalled if they are based on errors of fact which result from the acts and documents of the case .
Under LAW of LAW . CARDINAL of DATE , final judgments can be recalled with a view to excluding a person from his joint liability .
